channel.title: Qt on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Qt on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Error not finding Qt plugin cocoa in python-opencv
item.description: I'm quite worried, so memorandum Environment Mac OS 10.15.3 Python 3.7.3 (by homebrew) opencv-contrib-python 4.2.0.32 (by pip) opencv-python 4.2.0.32 (by pip) solution If you put in python-opencv and try the code of the obtained one, I get the following error. qt.qpa.plugin: Could not find the Qt platform plugin "cocoa" in "" This application failed to start because no Qt platform plugin could be initialized.Reinstalling the application may fix this problem.

item.title: [Python] Introduction to PyQt
item.description: # Qt 5.14 Release! ! I’m sorry for the story that has nothing to do with the theme. Everyone, Qt 5.14 has been released! ! ![Screenshot 2019-12-14 22.02.19.png](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/62136/a837169e-4959-ff53-5520-(2ab15686293e.png) When I tried to install Qt for the first time in a while, I noticed (I actually noticed when I was with hermit…). I thought I’d try to install 5.14 immediately, but this time I thought that LTS latest 5.12.6 was safe considering compatibility with binding tools etc.
